summary: Email correspondence between Kristina Lee Hendrickson of American Express's Special Investigations Financial Intelligence Unit and an individual named Rossmiller regarding Jeffrey Epstein's American Express accounts. Hendrickson offers to provide a copy of a file related to Epstein's account activity.

persons.name: Kristina Lee Hendrickson
persons.role: Manager - Special Investigations, Financial Intelligence Unit at American Express
persons.context: American Express employee who previously spoke with Rossmiller about Jeffrey Epstein's American Express account activity and is now offering to send a related file.

persons.name: Rossmiller
persons.context: Individual who previously spoke with Kristina Hendrickson about Jeffrey Epstein's American Express accounts and is being offered a copy of a related file.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual whose American Express account activity is being discussed and investigated by American Express's Special Investigations unit.

connections.description: Correspondence regarding the sharing of investigative information about Jeffrey Epstein's American Express accounts.
Hendrickson, as part of American Express's Special Investigations unit, is investigating activity on Epstein's accounts.

events.title: American Express Follow-up on Epstein Accounts
events.description: Kristina Hendrickson of American Express's Special Investigations unit emails Rossmiller to offer a copy of a file related to Jeffrey Epstein's American Express account activity.

keyFacts: American Express's Special Investigations Financial Intelligence Unit was actively investigating activity on Jeffrey Epstein's American Express accounts as of January 2020.
Kristina Lee Hendrickson, a manager in that unit, had previously spoken with an individual named Rossmiller about Epstein's accounts.
American Express had compiled a file on Epstein's account activity that they were willing to share with external parties.
The correspondence suggests ongoing financial investigations into Epstein's activities even after his death in 2019.
The email contains standard confidentiality disclaimers indicating the sensitive nature of the information being discussed.
